lines.gurmukhi: jYsy qau nirMd cViH bYTq pRXMk pr cwro KUt sY drb dyq Awin Awin kY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Tau Narind Charhhi Baitthat Prayank Para , Chaaro Khoot Sai Darab Dayt Aani Aani Kai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as when a king comes and sits on his throne, people from all over come to him with their problems and petitions or offerings,

lines.gurmukhi: kwhU kau irswie AwgXw krq jau mwrby kI qwqkwl mwir fwrIAq pRwn hwn kY
lines.transliteration_english: Kaahoo Kau Risaai Aagayaa Karat Jau Maarabay Kee , Taatakaal Maari Daareeat Praan Haan Kai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: And if the king angrily orders killing of a culprit, that person is executed at once.

lines.gurmukhi: kwhU kau pRsMn h√çY idKwvq hY lwK koit qurq BMfwrI gn dyiq Awn mwin kY
lines.transliteration_english: Kaahoo Kau Prasann Hvai Dikhaavat Hai Laakh Koti , Turat Bhandaaree Gan Dayti Aan Maani Kai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: And pleased with some noble and virtuous person, he orders giving millions of rupees to the honoured person, the cashier obeys the order and brings the required money immediately.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy dyq lyq hyq nyq kY bHmgXwnI lyp n ilpq hY bHmgXwn sXwn kY ]618]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Dayt Layt Hayt Nayt Kai Brahamagayaanee , Layp N Lipat Hai Brahamagayaan Sayaan Kai ?618?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a king remains impartial while passing judgment on a culprit or a noble person, so does an enlightened person feels God Almighty as the cause of all comforts and tribulations to human being and he himself remains aloof of these being a knower of L
